Product Summary: The Self Belaying device allows the climber to climb independently, allowing a climber to ascend without a partner holding the ropes and belaying
Positive: Self Belaying systems provide efficiency and safety when climbing in comparison to normal belaying devices. This system would enable a vision impaired individual to freely climb and eliminate the problematic process of a vision impaired individual belaying for a partner.
Minus: When connecting the carabina clips attached to the rope onto your harness, if the clips are let go the rope will automatically ascend up the wall, requiring a staff member to retrieve the rope. This could become an issue for vision impaired individuals when attempting to clip in
Improvement: To improve the design the self belaying rope must stay put when a climber is clipping in and not permanently rise or be activated
